title: 'Had a history of drug-related crimes': Dilraj Singh Gill shot dead in Canada, gang rivalry suspected
content: A 28-year-old Vancouver man with known gang links, Dilraj Singh Gill, was fatally shot in Burnaby on Thursday evening. Investigators believe this is part of B.C.'s escalating gang conflict, with a torched vehicle found nearby linked to the killing. Gill had a history of drug-related convictions and alleged ties to a group in conflict with the Brothers Keepers gang.

title: An argument that ended in four deaths: What happened inside the Indian home in Georgia
content: A domestic dispute in Georgia, US, tragically ended with an Indian-origin man allegedly killing his wife and three relatives. The couple's three children, who hid during the violence, alerted authorities. The suspect is now in custody facing multiple murder and cruelty charges. The victims have been identified, and the investigation is ongoing.

title: Haryana horror: 1-year-old boy kidnapped and strangled to death by mother’s Instagram friend
content: A one-year-old boy was allegedly kidnapped and strangled to death in Panchkula, Haryana. The accused, identified as Ajay, was arrested after posing as the child's father to abduct him from a crèche. Investigations are ongoing, with the boy's mother also being questioned.

title: 'India is not safe for us': BCB's final word as they say 'accept ICC's decision'
content: Bangladesh has accepted the ICC's decision to replace its national team with Scotland in the upcoming T20 World Cup. The Bangladesh Cricket Board cited government advice regarding safety concerns in India as the reason for their refusal to travel. Despite repeated efforts and alternative proposals, the ICC did not agree to relocate Bangladesh's matches.

title: Google AI CEO points out the 'big irony' in ChatGPT's plan to show ads
content: Google AI CEO Demis Hassabis questioned Sam Altman's AGI claims, highlighting the irony of OpenAI introducing ads in ChatGPT. Hassabis stated that true AGI, capable of human-level creativity and breakthroughs, is still 5-10 years away, not a marketing term for commercial gain.

title: Accenture CEO Julie Sweet urges hands-on learning; cites 300 leaders trained
content: Accenture CEO Julie Sweet stresses that leaders must grasp AI to guide their companies through transformation. She advocates for leader-led training, citing a client whose 300 leaders had to directly use AI tools before progress was made. This hands-on approach, starting with top executives, is crucial for unlocking AI's potential and ensuring widespread adoption across all sectors.

title: Srinagar-Jammu highway shut for third consecutive day amid heavy snowfall; hundreds stranded
content: The vital Srinagar-Jammu national highway remains shut for a third day due to fresh snowfall across Kashmir, stranding hundreds of vehicles. Snow clearance efforts are underway, but ongoing precipitation in Kulgam district is causing delays. Meanwhile, Srinagar city saw light snow, yet flight operations at the international airport continued without disruption.

title: PM Modi urges eligible youth to register as voters during Mann Ki Baat
content: Speaking during the 130th episode of his monthly radio programme Mann Ki Baat, Modi highlighted the significance of the upcoming Republic Day and the constitutional values it represents. He also drew attention to the importance of January 25, which is observed as National Voters’ Day, describing it as a key occasion in the democratic calendar.

title: Railway Budget 2026 expectations: 5 ways to drive growth engine for the Viksit Bharat
content: Railway Budget 2026: Though budgetary support on infrastructure build remains critical, linking these investments to structural reforms will be essential.

title: Amazon layoffs 'announced'; company set to cut thousands of jobs
content: Amazon is planning to cut approximately 14,000 corporate jobs starting next week, marking the second major layoff wave since October and bringing total reductions to 30,000 roles. CEO Andy Jassy clarified the cuts aren't driven by AI or financial concerns but by excessive bureaucracy and organizational layers. The layoffs will affect employees across AWS, retail, Prime Video, and human resources divisions, representing nearly 10% of Amazon's corporate workforce.

title: Who was Alex Jeffrey Pretti? 37-year old ICU nurse killed by ICE agent in Minneapolis shooting
content: An intensive care unit nurse, Alex Jeffrey Pretti, was fatally shot by a US border patrol officer during an immigration operation. Family members described him as a compassionate US citizen distressed by immigration policies. While authorities claim he approached officers with a handgun, bystander videos show him holding a phone. His family vehemently denies accusations of domestic terrorism.

title: 'Simple guy, never got angry': College teacher stabbed to death on Mumbai local
content: A college teacher was tragically murdered on a local train at Malad station. An argument over alighting led to the fatal stabbing. The Government Railway Police have arrested Omkar Shinde in connection with the incident. The victim, Alok Kumar Singh, was a faculty member at Narsee Monjee College. Investigations are ongoing, with police examining CCTV footage and witness statements.

title: T20 World Cup row: Shahid Afridi drags India–Pakistan angle, attacks ICC
content: Shahid Afridi criticises the ICC for its perceived double standards after Bangladesh was removed from the 2026 T20 World Cup. He contrasts this with India's security concerns being accommodated for the 2025 Champions Trophy, highlighting a lack of fairness in global cricket governance.

title: ‘Doesn’t pass the sniff test’: Netflix rejects Paramount’s offer for Warner Bros Discovery
content: Netflix co-CEO Greg Peters dismissed Paramount Skydance's $108 billion bid for Warner Bros. Discovery as unrealistic, citing its heavy reliance on debt. He contrasted it with Netflix's more stable $82.7 billion all-cash offer, which is gaining traction with shareholders.  The potential merger faces significant Hollywood and regulatory scrutiny.

title: Hyderabad godown fire: 3 dead, rescue operations underway; showroom owner on run
content: A calamity unfolded in Nampally as a fierce blaze erupted, taking the lives of three victims and leaving five others potentially trapped in the ominous depths of a cellar. This inferno, sparked by combustible materials, ravaged a local furniture showroom, with rescue efforts hampered by suffocating smoke and extreme heat.

title: 'Pistols, hockey, rods': Greater Noida baraat attacked over wedding ritual; 6 critical
content: A wedding procession in Greater Noida turned violent when a dispute over a ritual escalated, leaving six family members critically injured. Police have arrested two individuals and registered a case against 44 people, citing an old family rivalry as a potential motive for the attack.

title: Did Alex Pretti have a gun? What we know about Minneapolis shooting
content: Alex Pretti's fatal shooting has again brought the spotlight on the poor training of ICE agents, and the whether they are fit to deal with protesters.

title: Mastermind of Mirzapur's gym-based religious conversion racket arrested at Delhi airport
content: Mirzapur's alleged gym-based conversion and blackmail racket mastermind, Imran Khan, was apprehended at Delhi airport attempting to flee to Dubai. Carrying a Rs 25,000 bounty, his arrest brings the total to seven. Police also sealed five linked gyms. The racket targeted young women, using morphed content for blackmail and conversion pressure.

title: US snow storm cancelled your flight? Here's what you need to know
content: A powerful winter storm has caused widespread US air travel disruptions, leading to over 13,000 flight cancellations and impacting major airports. Airlines are waiving change fees and offering rebooking options, but compensation for meals or lodging during weather-related cancellations is not guaranteed.

title: How to 'walk' your way out of diabetes, high BP?
content: A sedentary lifestyle is fueling a health crisis, but a simple solution exists: walking. Experts emphasize that regular, brisk walking, even for shorter durations, significantly improves blood sugar, blood pressure, and overall well-being.  This accessible activity can even lead to remission for pre-diabetes and enhance medication effectiveness for existing conditions.

title: Nobel Laureate Roy Glauber says science is guesswork, not perfect logic
content: Roy Glauber, the physicist who won the 2005 Nobel Prize in Physics, challenged a core assumption about how science works. In interviews reflecting on his career, Glauber argued that real scientific breakthroughs rarely emerge from strict deduction. Instead, they grow out of intuition, guesswork, and sustained curiosity. His reflections offer a powerful career lesson for young scientists and educators, questioning how science is taught and how creativity truly enters research.

title: 'Voter a Bhagya Vidhata': PM Modi greets citizens on National Voters’ Day
content: National Voters’ Day is observed annually on January 25 to mark the foundation day of the Election Commission of India (ECI), established in 1950. The day aims to recognise voters, encourage youth participation, reinforce democratic values, and promote universal adult suffrage. In a post on X, the Prime Minister said National Voters’ Day is about “further deepening our faith in the democratic values of our nation”.

title: Amid cheating claims, Palash Muchhal deletes all Smriti Mandhana photos
content: Music composer Palash Muchhal faces renewed cheating allegations from actor-producer Vidnyan Mane, a friend of Smriti Mandhana. Mane claims Muchhal was caught with another woman during pre-wedding festivities, leading to a physical confrontation with cricketers. Muchhal has denied these claims, initiating a Rs 10 crore defamation suit against Mane.  Several Instagram posts featuring Mandhana have also been removed.

title: UP woman, wanting divorce, plants beef to frame husband in cow slaughter case
content: A shocking plot unfolded when a routine cow slaughter seizure revealed a wife's elaborate scheme to frame her husband for a second time.  Driven by a desire for divorce, she allegedly conspired with her lover, using burner phones and fake identities to plant beef and ensure his arrest.  The investigation uncovered a chilling tale of betrayal and manipulation.

title: 'Pakistan misguided Bangladesh': India's World Cup-winner's direct attack
content: Former India all-rounder Madan Lal backed the ICC's decision to replace Bangladesh with Scotland for the 2026 T20 World Cup, deeming it justified and timely. He suggested external influence led to Bangladesh's withdrawal, calling it a significant mistake that opens opportunities for Scotland.

title: Music composer and singer Abhijit Majumdar passes away at 54
content: Renowned music composer and singer Abhijit Majumdar passed away at 54 after a prolonged illness at AIIMS Bhubaneswar. He was admitted in September last year with a neurological disorder and multiple comorbid conditions. Despite initial recovery and plans for discharge, he succumbed to refractory septic shock and cardiac arrest on Sunday.

title: 'ICC gave Bangladesh warning': Virat Kohli's coach slams Bangladesh
content: Virat Kohli's childhood coach, Rajkumar Sharma, supports the ICC's decision to replace Bangladesh with Scotland in the T20 World Cup 2026. This follows Bangladesh's refusal to participate as scheduled, citing security concerns that the ICC and independent assessments found unsubstantiated. The ICC's move aims to maintain tournament integrity and avoid setting problematic precedents.

title: Winter rain improves Delhi air; AQI settles at ‘moderate’ 150
content: The deteriorating air quality of Delhi witnessed a significant improvement after the winter rain showered the capital city, with the Air Quality Index (AQI) recorded at 151, in the "moderate" category at 7 am on Sunday, according to the Central Pollution Control Board (CPCB).

title: US govt to get 10% stake in USA Rare Earth, Trump admin's push for domestic production
content: The US government is investing $1.6 billion in USA Rare Earth, acquiring a 10% stake to support a local mine and magnet production facility. This move aims to bolster domestic rare earth production, with the company also securing $1 billion in private funding. The investment includes government shares and warrants, priced near the company's recent trading levels.

title: 'What did you just do!' Second killing in Minneapolis by US federal agents - video captures horror
content: A second US citizen, Alex Jeffrey Pretti, was killed by Border Patrol officers in Minneapolis, weeks after another fatal shooting by federal agents. Footage shows officers tackling Pretti, who was holding a phone, and firing multiple shots even after he collapsed. Officials claim Pretti violently resisted disarming, but his family describes him as a caring nurse.

title: Heavy snowfall in Himachal: 685 roads closed, hundreds of tourists stranded
content: Himachal Pradesh grapples with severe disruption as heavy snowfall paralyzes transport, power, and water supply across multiple districts. Lahaul and Spiti remains cut off, with hundreds of tourists stranded in Manali. Authorities are working on a war footing to clear roads and restore essential services amidst freezing temperatures and significant snowfall in popular tourist spots.

title: 70-year-old Odisha man cycles 600km to take ailing wife to hospital in rickshaw
content: A 70-year-old man in Odisha pedalled his rickshaw van 300 km to take his wife for medical treatment and is now returning home the same way, refusing help. His unwavering devotion highlights the struggles of the poor in accessing healthcare and transport, a story that has gained significant attention.

title: SA20 Final: Stubbs hopes to make it three-in-four for SEC - preview
content: Sunrisers Eastern Cape captain Tristan Stubbs, who has had a mediocre return since the highs of 2024, is keen to find form in the SA20 final against the Pretoria Capitals. Having been called up to the T20 World Cup squad as an injury replacement, Stubbs has personal and team goals to achieve at Newlands in Cape Town.

title: 'She stopped crying to survive': Father beats 4-year-old to death over maths homework
content: A four-year-old girl in Faridabad was allegedly beaten to death by her father for a math assignment error. Neighbors reported the father, a private firm employee, frequently abused the child when drunk. The girl, Vanshika Jaiswal, was reportedly conditioned to avoid crying in front of him due to his violent reactions.

title: Doctor's advice on common traps: Dr Ankur Gahlot warns about hidden
content: Diabetes management often feels like a battle due to common lifestyle traps and misinformation, not necessarily the disease's inherent difficulty. Experts highlight that irregular routines, misconceptions about 'healthy' foods like fruit juices, and lack of consistent physical activity significantly impact blood sugar control. Understanding these pitfalls is key to avoiding constant struggle.

title: Ravindra Jadeja's 'attack kar' call sets up Shubman Gill's dismissal | Exclusive
content: Ravindra Jadeja's constant encouragement proved pivotal as Saurashtra's Parth Bhut dominated Shubman Gill, taking 10 wickets in their Ranji Trophy win over Punjab. Bhut, inspired by Jadeja, credited his hero's guidance for his match-winning performance and fulfilling a childhood dream of playing alongside him.

title: 'Border 2' box office collections day 2
content: Sunny Deol's 'Border 2' has made a strong debut, earning Rs 65 crore in its first two days. The war drama is projected to reach Rs 70 crore by its third day, solidifying its position as Sunny Deol's fourth highest-grossing film. The movie's success highlights Deol's continued box office appeal.

title: Travis Kelce shaken as Taylor Swift reportedly puts wedding plans on hold
content: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce might have a lot to deal with in their lives over the last few weeks. Amid all the mess, there have been reports of their wedding being “put on hold” as Taylor Swift is focusing on being there for Travis Kelce after a pretty poor season on the field. But it seems, Travis Kelce is not doing well emotionally.

title: 2 die as bullet train bridge plate ‘falls’ in Gujarat
content: A father and daughter tragically lost their lives when a heavy metal plate fell from an under-construction bullet train bridge onto their fishing boat on the Tapi River. The incident occurred near Kathore village, with the plate reportedly slipping from a crane. While the mother survived, the deceased were identified as Mohsin Shaikh and his nine-year-old daughter, Huma.

title: When will Alex Honnold’s dangerous Taipei 101 climb stream live on Netflix?
content: Alex Honnold will climb Taipei 101 live on Netflix on Saturday, Jan. 24, at 8 p.m. ET. The event, called “Skyscraper Live,” was delayed due to weather in Taiwan. Viewers can watch the full ropeless climb only on Netflix, featuring one of the world’s tallest buildings.

title: 'There's a coach at home': SKY reveals how his wife helped him rediscover form
content: Suryakumar Yadav revealed how patience, time in the middle, and a social media break helped him regain form after a challenging period. He credited his wife's advice and a focus on match performance over net sessions for his improved confidence.  He also emphasized the importance of team wins beyond individual performances.

title: Fans urge Travis Kelce to apologize to Justin Baldoni amid backlash
content: Travis Kelce's Instagram comments are buzzing with criticism, not football talk. A viral plea for him to apologize to 'Justin' on his podcast has ignited widespread demand for accountability. Notably, some Swifties are joining the chorus, questioning the situation's handling, a shift that amplifies the online discourse and Kelce's continued silence.

title: Buffalo Bills fans rally to bring back ex-coach Sean McDermott after firing
content: A passionate Buffalo Bills fan, Maria Maisonet, created a Change.org petition to reinstate head coach Sean McDermott, accumulating over 45,000 signatures. The fan believes McDermott’s dismissal is short-sighted, overlooking his contributions and player respect. She argues McDermott deserves a chance to coach in the new stadium [New Highmark Stadium]. Bills owner Terry Pegula sensed something in the locker room, which led to McDermott’s firing.

title: NBA postpones Warriors-Timberwolves over Minneapolis shooting
content: A fatal shooting involving federal agents in Minneapolis has led to the postponement of the Golden State Warriors vs. Minnesota Timberwolves game. The incident, which occurred Saturday morning, prompted the NBA's decision to reschedule the match for Sunday. This marks the third such encounter with federal officers in Minnesota this month.

title: 80 rescuers, no saviour: Who let Noida techie Yuvraj Mehta drown?
content: A young software engineer drowned in a Noida trench despite a massive rescue operation involving multiple agencies. Officials and the victim's father decried the "institutional failure," citing a lack of training, equipment, and coordination among first responders and specialized units. The tragedy exposed critical gaps in India's emergency response mechanism.

title: Mumbai Police books Vikram Bhatt, daughter in Rs 13.5 crore cheating case
content: Filmmaker Vikram Bhatt and his daughter Krishna Bhatt are facing a new fraud case in Mumbai, accused of cheating a Pune-based investor out of Rs 13.5 crore. The investor claims they were promised high returns on film projects but never received their principal or profits. The investigation has been transferred to the Economic Offences Wing.

title: BJP urges police to rescue 'abducted' son of industrialist in Jharkhand
content: A BJP delegation called on East Singhbhum Senior Superintendent of Police Piyush Pandey and expressed concern over the alleged abduction of industrialist Devang Gandhi's son Kairav on January 13

title: Old Alwal locals stage protest over traffic congestion and internet disruptions linked to TCS iON exam Centre
content: The examination centre installs jammers that results in internet connectivity getting disrupted and people working from home badly hit

title: Republic Day 2026: CBI officer who supervised R.G. Kar rape-murder case probe among 31 receiving police medal
content: Joint Director V. Chandrasekhar, a 2000-batch IPS officer from the Gujarat cadre, has been awarded the coveted President’s Medal for Distinguished Service

title: Rahul Gandhi ‘dictatorial, insecure leader’, says former Congress leader Shakeel Ahmad
content: The former Union minister, who quit after the Bihar Assembly polls, also claimed Rahul Gandhi does not listen to senior colleagues in the Congress

title: Control of RJD lies in hands of infiltrators, conspirators, claims Rohini Acharya
content: They misbehave with those who speak for 'Laluism' and the party's interests. They indulge in rude behaviour with the people who think for the betterment of the party..., alleges Lalu Prasad’s daughter Rohini Acharya

title: Mann Ki Baat: Indian products must be synonymous with top quality, says PM Modi
content: The Prime Minister also lauded the efforts of the youngsters, who participated enthusiastically in India’s start up journey that began 10 years ago in 2016

title: Police from three States begin search for missing currency
content: Police from three States begin search for missing currency. Maharashtra and Karnataka police to cooperate with Goa police

title: Arasavilli Sun God temple witnesses unprecedented rush on Ratha Saptami
content: There were serpentine queues of devotees for ‘sarva darshan’, ticket holders, and donors right from the early hours of January 25

title: Karnataka gender minorities survey report recommends separate welfare board, 1% reservation in private sector
content: The first of its kind exercise in India, conducted by the Department of Women and Child Development and the Karnataka State Women’s Development Corporation, has recorded 10,365 gender minority individuals in the State

title: Removing Mughals from textbooks is nonsense, history must be continuous: Historian Romila Thapar
content: “The kinds of things that are happening, where, for example, chunks of history are being thrown out of the syllabus, or we are told we don’t need to study them, are nonsense. History is a continuous process. It is an evolution of people and cultures, of ways of behaviour and ways of thinking," says Ms. Thapar

title: Iranian ambassador thanks India for opposing ‘unjust, politically motivated’ UNHRC resolution
content: UNHRC adopted a resolution extending the mandate of a fact-finding mission on Iran for two years, and also called for an urgent investigation of the protests which began on December 28, 2025

title: Accused held within 12 hours for professor’s murder at Mumbai’s Malad railway station
content: A minor argument between the victim, Alok Kumar Singh, a professor with NM College, and Shinde while they were alighting from a local train escalated into a brutal attack, the police official said

title: No space for Hindi then, now, or ever, says T.N. CM Stalin
content: In a social media post, the Tamil Nadu Chief Minister said no more lives would be lost over the language struggle

title: Heavy snowfall shuts 565 roads, disrupts power supply across Himachal Pradesh
content: According to the State Emergency Operation Centre (SEOC), the tribal district of Lahaul and Spiti is the worst affected, with 292 roads blocked. This includes NH-03 (Leh-Manali) and NH-505 (Kaza-Gramphu)

title: Election Commission facing sustained pressure, need to protect its independence: Kharge on Voters' Day
content: Snatching the "Right to Vote" through Vote Chori and unplanned Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of electoral rolls tarnishes India's long-cherished democracy, the Congress chief said

title: Denial of censor certificate: Producers of Lakshmi Lawrence Kadhal move Madras High Court
content: Justice K. Govindarajan Thilakavadi orders notice to CBFC and grants time till February 3 for filing a counter affidavit

title: Republic Day 2026: 982 personnel awarded gallantry and service medals
content: A total of 125 persons will be awarded with the Medal for Gallantry (GM); 121 from police force and four others are from Fire services

title: NEET aspirant death case: Forensic report of student’s clothes finds traces of semen, two police officials suspended
content: Police will obtain a DNA profile from the traces of semen detected in the forensic report, officials said

title: Participate in democratic processes, being voter greatest privilege: PM Modi
content: National Voters’ Day is celebrated on January 25 every year to mark the foundation day of the Election Commission of India

title: A.P. Discoms perform well in national power utility rankings
content: The Central and Southern power distribution companies have improved their ratings from ‘C’ to ‘B’ grade

title: Key accused in serial ‘prasadam’ killing cases gets life imprisonment
content: Simhadri  killed 10 people by serving them prasadam laced with cyanide;  another accused gets 10-year rigorous imprisonment for supplying the poison

title: In Frames: From African shores to Gujarat’s Gir
content: The Siddi Badshah community, descended from Africans brought to Junagadh centuries ago, thrives in Jambur and Shirvan villages of the Gir region

title: Shiv Sena (UBT) approaches police over two ‘missing’ corporators in Kalyan civic body
content: The possibility of pressure, fraud, kidnapping or other criminal nature behind this incident cannot be ruled out,” Shiv Sena (UBT) Kalyan district chief Sharad Shivraj Patil said

title: Ahead of key Delhi summit, EU leaders to begin India visit; to be chief guests at Republic Day function
content: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen kickstarted her four-day visit to India on Saturday (January 24, 2026)

title: Wake up from hibernation and activate SIR war rooms, Abhishek tells Trinamool MPs
content: The TMC leader Abhishek Banerjee said the work relating to SIR will have to be done by party workers during the day and in the evening, a film highlighting the achievements of Mamata Banerjee’s government will be screened

title: The hope for peace to prevail
content: Amid the recent violence in neighbouring Bangladesh, Indian families who had migrated to Bihar’s north-eastern district of Kishanganj in the 1960s, are concerned about family members who decided to stay back. Amarnath Tewary tells the stories of the migrants, who speak about the struggles of displacement and loss, as they now navigate worry

title: Koraput district administrator in Odisha bans sale of non-vegetarian food on Republic Day
content: Prohibiting non-vegetarian food items on a national holiday is nothing but a directive influenced by ideology of Rastriya Swayamsevak Sangh, says Koraput Lok Sabha MP Saptagiri Sankar Ulaka

title: AIDWA photo exhibition showcases women’s struggles
content: AIDWA Treasurer S. Punyavathy and Sudha S. inaugurated Art Exhibition Hall AND the Armed Struggles Gallery.

title: Rajasthan focuses on higher mining revenue targets in financial year-end
content: Director of Mines Mahaveer Prasad Meena said a revenue collection of ₹7,451.63 crore had been reported till January 21, which had recorded an increase of ₹627 crore over the amount of ₹6,824.54 crore collected in the same period during the financial year 2024-25.

title: Election Commission uploads on website names of people on logical discrepancies list following Supreme Court order
content: District electoral officers will now download the list and display it at panchayat bhavans and block offices in West Bengal

title: Government will extend full support for development of AIIMS: Minister Satya Kumar Yadav
content: The Minister said that within a short period, AIIMS-Mangalagiri have gained the trust of patients and said that out of the total 26 AIIMS in the country, 19 were operational and the remaining were in various stages of construction

title: India bears special responsibility to preserve, share principles of compassion, non-violence: Rijiju
content: “Under the leadership of Prime Minister Narendra Modi, India has undertaken a ‘proactive responsibility’ in providing an international platform for Buddhist monks, gurus, scholars, and thinkers, reinforcing the nation’s enduring commitment to peace and harmony,” Mr. Rijiju said

title: US Military To Prioritise Homeland And Curbing China, Limit Support For Allies
content: The US military will prioritise protecting the homeland and deterring China while providing "more limited" support to allies in Europe and elsewhere, a Pentagon strategy document said.

title: Stranded By Winter Weather? Heres What Airlines Owe You
content: Winter weather can upend even the best-laid travel plans, but one less thing to worry about is losing money if your flight is canceled.

title: Deaths Mount As Trump Immigration Push Intensifies
content: The fatal shooting of a man in Minneapolis on Saturday added to a mounting deaths in Trump's intensifying immigration push this month, increasing scrutiny on the crackdown as backlash builds.

title: Son Of Iranian President Calls For End To Internet Blackout
content: The son of Iran's president, who is also a government adviser, called on Saturday for internet connectivity to be restored, warning the more than two-week blackout there would exacerbate anti-government sentiment.

title: "Those In Charge...": Sister's Barb At Tejashwi Yadav Ahead Of Big RJD Meet
content: Ahead of the Rashtriya Janata Dal's national executive meeting in Patna, party patriarch Lalu Prasad Yadav's daughter Rohini Acharya has fired a barb at her brother and the party's face, Tejashwi Yadav.

title: Indian Products Must Be Synonymous With Top Quality: PM Modi
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday urged industry and start ups to focus on quality and resolve to make excellence a benchmark in manufacturing.

title: Professor Stabbed To Death At Mumbai Station, CCTV Shows Killer Escaping
content: In a chilling reminder of the volatility within Mumbai's crowded transit system, the Government Railway Police (GRP) have arrested 27-year-old Omkar Shinde for the brutal murder of a college professor at Malad Railway Station.

title: A Bereaved Father In Gaza Tries To Will His Son Back From The Dead
content: The hospital said 15-year-old Mohammad and his 13-year-old cousin were killed by an Israeli strike as they searched for firewood.

title: On National Girl Child Day, Delhi's Top Voices Join NGO To Launch Book 'ZIDD'
content: On National Girl Child Day, non-profit organisation MukkaMaar brought together senior representatives from the Delhi Government, Delhi Police and the child rights sector for a high-level panel discussion on girl safety and empowerment.

title: How India Observed Republic Day Amid Press Censorship During Emergency
content: When India marked Republic Day in 1976 and 1977, the country was under a national Emergency imposed by Prime Minister Indira Gandhi. The 21-month period, from June 25, 1975, to March 21, 1977, altered the political and civic environment.

title: "Frivolous": Meta On Lawsuit Claiming It Can Access WhatsApp Chats
content: A lawsuit against Meta in the US has alleged that its privacy claims are false and Meta and WhatsApp "store, analyse, and can access virtually all of WhatsApp users' private' communications".

title: Participate In Democratic Processes, Being Voter Greatest Privilege: PM Modi
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday urged people to take part in democratic processes, saying being a voter is not just a constitutional privilege, but an important duty that gives every citizen a voice in shaping India's future.

title: Indian-Origin Man, 28, Shot Dead In Canada's Burnaby, Cops Suspect Gang War
content: Police in Canada's Burnaby have said the targeted killing of a 28-year-old Indian-origin man on Thursday could have been the result of a gang war

title: How An Odisha Man Killed A Leopard Who Attacked Him And Pet Dog
content: A late-night clash between a man and a wild animal in Odisha's Cuttack district led to the death of a leopard and left a young local resident seriously injured. The incident has caused panic among villagers in nearby areas.

title: Republic Day 2026: 982 Police Personnel Awarded Service Medals, J&K Gets Most
content: On the occasion of the Republic Day 2026, gallantry and various service medals have been awarded to 982 police, fire, home guard, civil defence and correctional services personnel.

title: Hindu Garage Worker Burnt Alive By Unknown Men While Sleeping In Bangladesh
content: Yet another horrific incident has come to light amid violence against Hindu minorities in Bangladesh, where elections are due in less than a few weeks.

title: Venezuela Hopes Boost Oil Production By 18% In 2026: State-owned Body
content: Venezuela wants to boost its oil production by 18 percent this year through planned reforms that will fully open the sector to private investors, the head of the state oil giant PDVSA said.

title: 'Inciting Insurrection': Trump Accuses Officials After Minneapolis Shooting
content: US President Donald Trump accused the mayor of Minneapolis and the state's governor of "inciting insurrection" over their response to the killing of a civilian in the city by federal officers.

title: 'Time To Start Doing Something': Minnesotans Step Up To Take On ICE
content: Activists say they have been overwhelmed by new volunteers - despite the potential for violence - since Renee Good was killed by ICE agent Jonathan Ross.

title: Republicans Eye 'Trump-palooza' Convention Ahead Of US Midterms
content: US President Donald Trump's Republican Party has taken a step closer to staging a highly unusual party convention to prop him up and sell his message to voters ahead of crucial midterm elections in November.

title: Women employees entitled to maternity leave for third pregnancy too, reiterates Madras High Court
content: Justices R. Suresh Kumar and Shamim Ahmed direct Chief Secretary to circular their order to all HoDs so that they do not deny such benefit in future

title: Chief Minister Stalin opposes NEET for allied and health care courses
content: In a letter to Prime Minister Narendra Modi, he says the National Commission for Allied and Health Care Professions has made a ‘hasty and ad hoc decision’ with ‘multiple deleterious consequences’

title: Migrant worker from Beldanga ‘died by suicide’ in Jharkhand, says West Bengal Police
content: Violence erupted at Beldanga in Murshidabad on January 16 over the death of 30-year-old migrant worker Alauddin Sheikh; a large number of people took to the streets by blocking railway tracks and national highway for several hours

title: Internet back in two Assam districts after violence-induced shutdown
content: The district authorities said life was slowly returning to normal in Kokrajhar, but security would continue to be high

title: Home Ministry to display tableau on three new criminal laws at Republic Day parade
content: It will showcase India’s transition to a modern, technology-driven, time-bound, and citizen-centric justice system, says the Ministry

title: Delhi court acquits Medha Patkar in defamation case filed by L-G V.K. Saxena
content: Court says neither the reporter who recorded the audio-video nor any person who had seen the accused making the impugned statements had been examined as a witness

title: Citing threat to public order, MHA orders blocking of Manipur killing video
content: Social media intermediaries such as YouTube, Meta, and Google have been directed to take down the viral video of the January 21 killing of a 29-year-old man in Manipur’s Churachandpur

title: India's youth must remain prepared to take on every challenge: Rajnath
content: The Defence Minister described NCC cadets as the nation’s second line of defence and urged them to contribute to Modi-led government’s vision of making India a developed nation by 2047, while addressing a gathering of cadets in Delhi Cantonment

title: Karnataka Ombudsman has heard 108 HIV Act complaints since July 2021
content: The complaints pertained to stigma, discrimination, and denial of services between July, 2021, and December, 2025

title: Forward Bloc urges govt. to avoid bringing back Netaji’s ashes
content: At gathering to mark Netaji’s 129th birth anniversary, G. Devarajan, General Secretary of the All India Forward Bloc, asks the government to formally accept the Mukherjee Commission Report, which concluded that Bose did not die in the alleged plane crash in Taiwan, on August 18, 1945

title: Five feared trapped as fire engulfs furniture store in Nampally; eyewitnesses recall horror
content: The building forms part of a tightly packed row of furniture showrooms and commercial establishments, a factor that, according to officials, contributed to the rapid spread of fire and smoke

title: SIR rollout in remaining States soon: CEC Gyanesh Kumar
content: On the eve of the Election Commission's foundation day — also celebrated as National Voters' Day — Mr. Kumar said the revision exercise is presently being conducted "smoothly" in 12 States and Union territories

title: R-Day celebrations: 37 contingents to take part in the parade; traffic diversions announced
content: Citizens interested in attending the event can obtain passes through the Seva Sindhu website. Around 2,000 e-passes have been issued for the general public

title: Nipah scare: RT-PCR tests conducted on bats at Kolkata zoo
content: Samples have recently been collected from bat populations in Madhyamgram, Barasat and Basirhat in West Bengal; Alipore Zoo remains the only facility in Kolkata that houses a bat enclosure, prompting health authorities to include it in the surveillance drive

title: RJD MLA Bhai Virendra questions ticket distribution by party leadership
content: In the recent Bihar Assembly election, deserving and hard-working party workers were ignored, and ‘outsiders’ allocated tickets based on ‘other criteria’, the Maner MLA alleges

title: Akali Dal plans to start campaigns early for 2027 Punjab Assembly polls
content: At a meeting of party functionaries on Saturday, the SAD announced plans to organise a series of rallies in all Assembly constituencies in the State starting next month and outlined its strategy to reconnect with voters.

title: CBSE makes appointment of socio-emotional, career counsellors mandatory in all affiliated schools
content: The proposed policy reform is aimed at strengthening students' mental health and providing them with career guidance

title: Congress cites The Hindu report to target Centre over Great Nicobar project, calls Modi government ‘indifferent’
content: Responding to allegations of coercion of tribal communities, former Environment Minister Jairam Ramesh says, “This is unacceptable and shows how the project is being bulldozed through. It is an ecological disaster”

title: 3.5 lakh ‘unmapped’ voters do not turn up for SIR hearing in West Bengal
content: While the last date for hearings for unmapped voters ended this week, the Election Commission has extended the date till February 7.

title: No cooked food, limited clothes: Karnataka issues new prison regulations
content: The new set of regulations comes in the backdrop of a series of exposés of preferential treatment to prisoners inside Parappana Agrahara Central Prison, Bengaluru

title: Man falls into compactor machine at GHMC transfer station in Yousufguda, dies
content: While workers at the transfer station protested alleging inadequate safety measures, GHMC denied that the deceased was an employee at the site

title: Court defers bail plea of Shimjitha Musthafa
content: Magistrate M. Athira deferred the bail plea on Saturday after the prosecution cited the risk of witness tampering and the ongoing forensic analysis of her mobile phone for further investigation

title: People might not have anticipated SIR to be more cumbersome than routine revisions: Kerala CEO
content: Rathan U. Kelkar said in the previous revisions, physical verification was mostly undertaken only when objections were raised. “Now, officials are visiting homes and checking records in all cases. Naturally, this caused some initial concern among people,” he said.

title: TN man allegedly dies in police custody
content: He was reportedly taken into preventive custody on January 23, 2026, after residents alerted the police about finding him at Chembumukku in Vazhakkala under suspicious circumstances

title: A stage for the unheard: ITFoK opens with plays, politics and performance
content: With the theme ‘Voices in This Silence’, the 16th Sixteenth International Theatre Festival of Kerala brings 23 plays from nine countries to Thrissur, turning the stage into a space for the marginalised

title: 'Fantastic': Luka's clutch defense seals Lakers' win
content: Lakers coach JJ Redick praised Luka Doncic as "fantastic" after his clutch, late defensive plays against Dallas on Saturday night.

title: Emotional Rose sees Bulls' No. 1 jersey retired
content: The Chicago Bulls retired Derrick Rose's No. 1 jersey after Saturday's 106-103 victory against the Boston Celtics, and the former guard grew emotional throughout the ceremony.

title: Gaethje wins interim title in slugfest with Pimblett
content: Justin Gaethje scored multiple knockdowns of Paddy Pimblett and won the UFC interim lightweight belt Saturday night, setting the stage for a unification bout with Ilia Topuria.

title: Reinstated Bediako has 13 points in Bama return
content: Alabama's Charles Bediako had four dunks, two steals and two blocks in his return to college basketball Saturday.

title: Source: Ohio State to hire ex-Steelers OC Smith
content: Ohio State is finalizing a deal to make former Pittsburgh Steelers playcaller Arthur Smith its offensive coordinator, a source told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: Dybantsa's 1st 40-point effort lifts BYU over Utah
content: BYU forward AJ Dybantsa scored 43 points on 15-of-24 shooting from the floor, breaking his program's freshman scoring record, as the No. 13 Cougars cruised to a 91-78 victory over the rival Utah Utes on Saturday.

title: Rodman marks 'fresh start' in scoring U.S. return
content: USWNT coach Emma Hayes heralded a "fresh start" for Trinity Rodman after the forward scored in just her second match since the 2024 Olympics in a 6-0 rout of Paraguay.

title: Sans ropes, Honnold climbs to top of Taipei 101
content: American Alex Honnold climbed to the top of the 1,667-foot Taipei 101 skyscraper on Saturday without the help of ropes or any protective equipment.

title: 🏈 Reid's NFL draft QB Hot Board: Mendoza top?
content: Who are the best quarterbacks in the 2026 class? We sized up the top 12, starting with Fernando Mendoza and Ty Simpson.

title: Steelers to hire Mike McCarthy: Six questions on the new coach, plus a grade
content: The Pittsburgh native and former Dallas Cowboys coach will take over a team with questions starting with QB.

title: Follow live: Gauff survives major scare; Ukraine's Oliynykova targets Sabalenka again
content: World No. 1s Carlos Alcaraz and Aryna Sabalenka will return to Rod Laver Arena on Day 8, eyeing their places in the quarterfinals. Coco Gauff and top-ranked Australian Alex de Minaur will also be in action.

title: Midseason lessons for all 30 NBA teams: Trade dramas, standings surprises dominate the first half
content: What have we learned about every team throughout the first half of 2025-26? Tim Bontemps canvasses the league.

title: Broncos' elite defense has a weakness the Patriots are set up to exploit
content: Denver's D has been vulnerable to big plays from running backs and tight ends in the middle of the field.

title: 'You should've never been born': How Buss family infighting drove the $10B sale of the Lakers
content: The post-Jerry Buss era was defined by resentment, dysfunction and conflict -- and ended with the loss of the most valuable family-owned franchise in the world.

title: Two NFL conference title games, two matchup previews: We have predictions, score picks and X factors
content: Drake Maye vs. Jarrett Stidham. Matthew Stafford vs. Sam Darnold. We have picks, stats to know and more for the AFC and NFC title games.

title: Breaking down Pats-Broncos, Rams-Seahawks via Next Gen Stats
content: Drake Maye vs. the blitz? Sam Darnold using play-action? Here are key metrics to help analyze Sunday's games.

title: Can Sam Darnold overcome his nemesis -- the L.A. Rams -- to get to Super Bowl?
content: Seahawks quarterback Sam Darnold has struggled with turnovers against the Rams. Will Sunday be different?

title: How NFL players prepare for the coldest games of the year
content: Even as beards freeze and fingers lose feeling, NFL players find ways to handle ridiculously cold temperatures.

title: Liverpool's inconsistencies have never been made more apparent
content: Liverpool's last-minute loss to Bournemouth has further strengthened the faults that the team has encountered all season long.

title: Barcelona deny Real Madrid another trophy, but the gap is closing
content: Barcelona may have lifted their sixth Spanish Supercopa in a row, but it's clear that Real Madrid can now go toe-to-toe with their eternal rivals.

title: Leicester City? Texas Western? A search for Indiana football's best cross-sport comparison
content: Was Indiana's title the greatest story in sports history? There might never be an objective answer, but we polled our experts for comparable arguments in other sports.

title: Ranking the 100 best college football players from the 2025 season

content: The good (Nebraska), not-so-good (Kentucky) and interesting (dominant freshmen) of the 2025-26 season so far.

title: Women's Bracketology: Chavez, OT win boost Sooners' hopes of hosting
content: Three straight losses sent the Sooners tumbling out of the top 16. They return after beating South Carolina.

title: Predictions for rest of MLB offseason: Where will the best ace available sign? Who will make a major trade?
content: How will the rest of free agency play out? Here's what our experts think could go down between now and spring training.

title: The new Mets are better than the old Mets -- and we can prove it
content: New York will have a new look for 2026. We break down what has changed and whether the team has improved.

content: The Canes move into the top 3, while the Penguins and Mammoth rise too. Which team was the biggest faller?

content: Helping you decide whether to give up on a few struggling players or believe in those who are ascending.
